page.lettertext:
fol.126r
To the Marchants Adventurers at London
Right worshipfull, in
e cause recommended by yo
r
l
re
I have delt w
th
e
states
to such effect as yo
u
requ[est]
I have delivered unto them her
Ma
t
l
re
s & used a[ll]
manner of earnest endevour as well in publick w
th
e g
na
l assembly, as w
th
e moste of them a
te to
cure
them to incline to some friendly resolution. But theyr
humor ys so froward when they take a cause in hand,
as I can give yo
u
no hope, that they will yeeld to
yo
r
demandes. They have framed an answere to her
Ma
t
l
re
, w
ch
I send you heerinclosed to be delivere[d]
when yo
u
please, & a transcript of
e same. But
the having of theyr answere upon a l
re
from
e com[pany]
at
Middelbourg
I have [move] them again to ad[.]
communication of deputies on both sydes, to accommod[ate]
all
e matter, & that
e trade may have his course
while those deputies are in conference, promising u[nto]
them that for the tares that shalbe made in any of
o
r
clothers, while matters are in speech, they shal alw[.]
be allowed according to
e agreement they have noth[ing]
to oppose against
e equity of this motion, & yet they [.]
that for the p
nt
they cannot oth
r
wise resolve them th[ey]
have signifyed alredy in theyr l
re
to her Ma
ty
. But [as]
far as I
ceave until the matter be accorded bet[ween]
Holland
&
Zeland
you are not to expect for [other] a[.]
at theyr hand
. For Holland as yt seemeth [.]
draw
e traffiqe to th
e
selves, w
ch
they of Zela[nd .]
w
th
stand, & wil not suffer that theyr placcart
[.]
published w
th
them. I have signified to
e Company [that]
is at Midelboro, what further course in my opinion
may take in this matter, wherof I know they will infor[.]
if they finde it for theyr purpose. For mine owne
[te]
for that w
ch
I am able by my travel or counsel or [.]
help whatseover to effect in
at behalf, I beseech [.]
swaded that
I
will willingly
fourme yt. & so I l[eave]
you at this p
nt
wishing this & all other yo
r
action[s and]
endevours most prosperous successe.
Hage. Ap
r
8 [1592]
